## Sea ice extent summary

<img src="img/nbering.png" alt="Northern Bering" style="float: right; width: 200px;"/>

The sea ice extent is derived from the sea ice concentration remote sensing data. 
The sea ice extent is calculated as the total area, measured in square kilometers 
(km<sup>2</sup>), where each grid cell exhibits a sea ice concentration of 15% or more.

The Alaska region is made up of distinct large marine ecosystems across: 
the Gulf of Alaska (GOA), Aleutian Islands (AI), eastern Bering Sea (EBS), 
northern Bering Sea, and Chukchi Sea and Beaufort Seas (referred to here as the Alaskan Arctic). 
Fishery management areas include the Gulf of Alaska and Bering Sea/Aleutian Islands.
No federal fisheries currently occur in the Alaskan Arctic.

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| results: 'hide'

 
library(chartjs)
library(RColorBrewer)
library(dplyr)
library(gt)
library(downloadthis)
library(ggplot2)
library(reshape2)

yearly_df = read.csv("data/nbering_yearly.csv")
baseline_df = read.csv("data/nbering_baseline.csv")
dfile = rbind(yearly_df, baseline_df)

    # Current Year
    currentYear = format(Sys.Date(), "%Y")
    current <- max(yearly_df$year)
    last <- max(yearly_df$year) -1 

    dfile$label = as.character(dfile$year)
    dfile[dfile$year == 1111,]$label = "Baseline (1985-2015)"
    dfile$seaice_extent = round(dfile$seaice_extent / 1000000, 2)


    var_orders = c(as.character(current), as.character(last),"Baseline (1985-2015)", "1985-2022")
    plot_colors = c("#318CE7", "#F08080", "#94C973", "#EEEEEE", "#EEEEEE", "#EEEEEE")
    color_map <- setNames(plot_colors, var_orders)
 
    customColors = list(border = plot_colors,
                        background = plot_colors)

```


```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false


df_base = dfile[dfile$year %in% c(1111, last:current), c("label", "month", "seaice_extent", "year" )]

df_base.wide = reshape(data=df_base, idvar= "month",
                    v.names= c("seaice_extent"),
                    timevar= "label",
                    direction = "wide")
names(df_base.wide) <- gsub("seaice_extent.","", names(df_base.wide))

```

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false

# Find max and min
pastyears <- dfile[dfile$year <= last -1, ] %>%
  group_by(month) %>%
  summarize(
    min_extent = min(seaice_extent, na.rm = TRUE),
    max_extent = max(seaice_extent, na.rm = TRUE),
  ) %>%
  arrange(month)
```
```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false

# Plot
df_base$month <- factor(df_base$month, levels = 1:12)
ice_ext_plot <- df_base %>%  
  ggplot( aes(x=month, y=seaice_extent, group=as.character(label), color=as.character(label))) +
    geom_point() +
    geom_line(data=dfile[dfile$year <= last -1, ], aes(x=month, y=seaice_extent), color='#eeeeee', label = "1985-2022") +
    geom_line(data = subset(df_base, label == var_orders[3] ),linewidth=1) +
    geom_line(aes(color = "1985-2022"), linewidth =0) +
    geom_line(data = subset(df_base, label == var_orders[2] ),linewidth=1) +
    geom_line(data = subset(df_base, label == var_orders[1]),linewidth=1) +
    labs(title = "Sea Ice Extent",
       x = "Month",
       y = "Millions in km squared",
       color = "") +
    scale_color_manual(values=color_map) +
    theme_light() + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5), legend.position="top") 

```

## Sea ice concentration data

The sea ice extent is calculated using remote sensing data on sea ice concentration from NOAA/NSIDC, made available by [PolarWatch](https://polarwatch.noaa.gov/). There are two versions of this data: near-real-time and science quality. For the purposes of this data summary, the science quality data were utilized, which are subject to approximately a three-month delay due to quality control processes.

*Sea Ice Concentration, NOAA/NSIDC Climate Data Record V4, Northern Hemisphere, 25km, Science Quality, 1978-Present, Monthly*
